definition: to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: And I have seen the eternal Footman hold my coat, and snicker.
sentences.chinese: 我曾眼见永恒的守门人接过我的大衣，然后窃笑。

sentences.english: Dick told the door keeper to dig a deep hole in the dark muddy garden.
sentences.chinese: 迪克要守门人在花园里的黑泥中挖一个深洞。

sentences.english: Why they regard the giraffe as the "doorkeeper" of the company?
sentences.chinese: 为什么将长颈鹿作为公司的“守门人”？

sentences.english: The doorkeeper gave the alarm as soon as he saw the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 守门人一看见冒烟就发出警报。

sentences.english: We are now declared free from the tyranny of The Gatekeeper.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们宣布要挣脱“守门人”的专制。

sentences.english: I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of lord than dwell in the tents of wickedness.
sentences.chinese: 我与其住在罪孽的天幕中，还不如做神殿的守门人。

sentences.english: As he was walking to the station, he noticed one of his night watchmen.
sentences.chinese: 在他走去火车站的时，他看到一个夜间守门人。

sentences.english: If the brain has a gatekeeper of sensory information, the hippocampus is it .
sentences.chinese: 如果脑部对感觉讯息有个守门人，则非海马回莫属。

definition: to keep goal/on duty as gatekeeper
